member.name: T:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Eye Adaptation effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.Mode
member.summary: The effect rendering mode used for the exposure processing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.SpeedUp
member.summary: The speed at which the exposure changes when the scene brightness moves from a dark area to a bright area (brightness goes up).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.SpeedDown
member.summary: The speed at which the exposure changes when the scene brightness moves from a bright area to a dark area (brightness goes down).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.PreExposure
member.summary: The pre-exposure value applied to the scene color before performing post-processing (such as bloom, lens flares, etc.).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.PostExposure
member.summary: The post-exposure value applied to the scene color after performing post-processing (such as bloom, lens flares, etc.) but before color grading and tone mapping.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.MinBrightness
member.summary: The minimum brightness for the auto exposure which limits the lower brightness the eye can adapt within.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.MaxBrightness
member.summary: The maximum brightness for the auto exposure which limits the upper brightness the eye can adapt within.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.HistogramLowPercent
member.summary: The lower bound for the luminance histogram of the scene color. Value is in percent and limits the pixels below this brightness. Use values from range 60-80. Used only in AutomaticHistogram mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.EyeAdaptationSettings.HistogramHighPercent
member.summary: The upper bound for the luminance histogram of the scene color. Value is in percent and limits the pixels above this brightness. Use values from range 80-95. Used only in AutomaticHistogram mode.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Depth Of Field effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.Enabled
member.summary: If checked, depth of field effect will be visible.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BlurStrength
member.summary: The blur intensity in the out-of-focus areas. Allows reducing blur amount by scaling down the Gaussian Blur radius. Normalized to range 0-1.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.FocalDistance
member.summary: The distance in World Units from the camera that acts as the center of the region where the scene is perfectly in focus and no blurring occurs.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.FocalRegion
member.summary: The distance in World Units beyond the focal distance where the scene is perfectly in focus and no blurring occurs.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.NearTransitionRange
member.summary: The distance in World Units from the focal region on the side nearer to the camera over which the scene transitions from focused to blurred.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.FarTransitionRange
member.summary: The distance in World Units from the focal region on the side farther from the camera over which the scene transitions from focused to blurred.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.DepthLimit
member.summary: The distance in World Units which describes border after that there is no blur (useful to disable DoF on sky). Use 0 to disable that feature.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehEnabled
member.summary: If checked, bokeh shapes will be rendered.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehSize
member.summary: Controls size of the bokeh shapes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehShape
member.summary: Defines bokeh shapes type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehShapeCustom
member.summary: If BokehShape is set to Custom, then this texture will be used for the bokeh shapes. For best performance, use small, compressed, grayscale textures (for instance 32px).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehBrightnessThreshold
member.summary: The minimum pixel brightness to create bokeh. Pixels with lower brightness will be skipped.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehBlurThreshold
member.summary: Depth of Field bokeh shapes blur threshold.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehFalloff
member.summary: Controls bokeh shapes brightness falloff. Higher values reduce bokeh visibility.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.DepthOfFieldSettings.BokehDepthCutoff
member.summary: Controls bokeh shape generation for depth discontinuities.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Screen Space Reflections effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.Intensity
member.summary: The effect intensity (normalized to range [0;1]). Use 0 to disable it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.DepthResolution
member.summary: The depth buffer downscale option to optimize raycast performance. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.RayTracePassResolution
member.summary: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.BRDFBias
member.summary: The reflection spread parameter. This value controls source roughness effect on reflections blur. Smaller values produce wider reflections spread but also introduce more noise. Higher values provide more mirror-like reflections. Default value is 0.82.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.RoughnessThreshold
member.summary: The maximum amount of roughness a material must have to reflect the scene. For example, if this value is set to 0.4, only materials with a roughness value of 0.4 or below reflect the scene. The default value is 0.45.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.WorldAntiSelfOcclusionBias
member.summary: The offset of the raycast origin. Lower values produce more correct reflection placement, but produce more artifacts. We recommend values of 0.3 or lower. The default value is 0.1.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.ResolvePassResolution
member.summary: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance. The default value is half.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.ResolveSamples
member.summary: The number of rays used to resolve the reflection color. Higher values provide better quality but reduce effect performance. Default value is 4. Use 1 for the highest speed.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.EdgeFadeFactor
member.summary: The point at which the far edges of the reflection begin to fade. Has no effect on performance. The default value is 0.1.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.FadeOutDistance
member.summary: The effect fade out end distance from camera (in world units).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.FadeDistance
member.summary: The effect fade distance (in world units). Defines the size of the effect fade from fully visible to fully invisible at FadeOutDistance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.UseColorBufferMips
member.summary: "The input color buffer downscale mode that uses blurred mipmaps when resolving the reflection color. Produces more realistic results by blurring distant parts of reflections in rough (low-gloss) materials. It also improves performance on most platforms but uses more memory.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalEffect
member.summary: If checked, enables the temporal pass. Reduces noise, but produces an animated "jittering" effect that's sometimes noticeable. If disabled, the properties below have no effect.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalScale
member.summary: The intensity of the temporal effect. Lower values produce reflections faster, but more noise. The default value is 8.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalResponse
member.summary: Defines how quickly reflections blend between the reflection in the current frame and the history buffer. Lower values produce reflections faster, but with more jittering. If the camera in your game doesn't move much, we recommend values closer to 1. The default value is 0.8.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Anti Aliasing effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.Mode
member.summary: The anti-aliasing effect mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_JitterSpread
member.summary: The diameter (in texels) inside which jitter samples are spread. Smaller values result in crisper but more aliased output, while larger values result in more stable but blurrier output.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_Sharpness
member.summary: Controls the amount of sharpening applied to the color buffer. TAA can induce a slight loss of details in high frequency regions. Sharpening alleviates this issue. High values may introduce dark-border artifacts.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_StationaryBlending
member.summary: The blend coefficient for stationary fragments. Controls the percentage of history sample blended into final color for fragments with minimal active motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_MotionBlending
member.summary: The blending coefficient for moving fragments. Controls the percentage of history sample blended into the final color for fragments with significant active motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.NonJitteredProjection
member.summary: The projection matrix with no camera offset (no jittering). For many temporal image effects, the camera that is currently rendering needs to be slightly offset from the default projection (that is, the camera is jittered). If you use motion vectors and camera jittering together, use this property to keep the motion vectors stable between frames.

member.summary: The inverted view matrix.

member.summary: The inverted projection matrix.

member.summary: The draw passes mask for the current view rendering.

member.summary: Flag used by static, offline rendering passes (eg. reflections rendering, lightmap rendering etc.)

member.summary: The view flags.

member.summary: Maximum allowed shadows quality for this view

member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the render view.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the render view. Higher values increase LODs quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ShadowModelLODBias
member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ShadowModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Higher values increase LODs quality. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality.

member.summary: The Temporal Anti-Aliasing jitter frame index.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ViewInfo
member.summary: The view information vector with packed components to reconstruct linear depth and view position from the hardware depth buffer. Cached before rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ScreenSize
member.summary: The screen size packed (x - width, y - height, zw - inv width, w - inv height). Cached before rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.TemporalAAJitter
member.summary: The temporal AA jitter packed (xy - this frame jitter, zw - previous frame jitter). Cached before rendering. Zero if TAA is disabled. The value added to projection matrix (in clip space).

member.summary: The previous frame view matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.PrevProjection
member.summary: The previous frame projection matrix.

member.summary: The previous frame view * projection matrix.

member.summary: Square of . Cached by rendering backend.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Init(FlaxEngine.TextureBase.InitData@)
member.summary: Initializes the texture storage container with the given data. Valid only for virtual assets. Can be used in both Editor and at runtime in a build game. It does not perform any data streaming or uploading to the GPU. Only the texture resource is being initialized and the data is copied to be streamed later.
member.remarks: Can be used only for virtual assets (see and ).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionMappings
member.summary: Maps a discrete button or key press events to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to event-driven behavior. The end effect is that pressing (and/or releasing) a key, mouse button, or keypad button.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisMappings
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAction(System.String)

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAxis(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the virtual axis identified by name. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: The current axis value (e.g for gamepads it's in the range -1..1). Value is smoothed to reduce artifacts.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAxisRaw(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the raw value of the virtual axis identified by name with no smoothing filtering applied. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: The current axis value (e.g for gamepads it's in the range -1..1). No smoothing applied.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Mouse
member.summary: Represents a single hardware mouse device. Used by the Input to report raw mouse input events.
member.remarks: The mouse device position is in screen-space (not game client window space).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mouse.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Mouse.Position
member.summary: Gets the position of the mouse in the screen-space coordinates.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Mouse.PositionDelta
member.summary: Gets the delta position of the mouse in the screen-space coordinates.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Mouse.ScrollDelta
member.summary: Gets the mouse wheel change during the last frame.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mouse.GetButton(FlaxEngine.MouseButton)
member.summary: Gets the mouse button state (true if being pressed during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user holds down the button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mouse.GetButtonDown(FlaxEngine.MouseButton)
member.summary: Gets the mouse button down state (true if was pressed during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user starts pressing down the button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mouse.GetButtonUp(FlaxEngine.MouseButton)
member.summary: Gets the mouse button up state (true if was released during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user releases the button, otherwise false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.Name
member.summary: The action "friendly name" used to access it from code.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.Mode
member.summary: The trigger mode. Allows to specify when input event should be fired.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.Key
member.summary: The keyboard key to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.MouseButton
member.summary: The mouse button to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.GamepadButton
member.summary: The gamepad button to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig.Gamepad
member.summary: Which gamepad should be used.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Name
member.summary: The axis "friendly name" used to access it from code.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Axis
member.summary: The axis type (mouse, gamepad, etc.).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Gamepad
member.summary: Which gamepad should be used.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.PositiveButton
member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in positive direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.NegativeButton
member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in negative direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.DeadZone
member.summary: Any positive or negative values that are less than this number will register as zero. Useful for gamepads to specify the deadzone.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Sensitivity
member.summary: For keyboard input, a larger value will result in faster response time (in units/s). A lower value will be more smooth. For Mouse delta the value will scale the actual mouse delta.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Gravity
member.summary: For keyboard input describes how fast will the input recenter. Speed (in units/s) that output value will rest to neutral value if not when device at rest.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Scale
member.summary: Additional scale parameter applied to the axis value. Allows to invert it or modify the range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Snap
member.summary: If enabled, the axis value will be immediately reset to zero after it receives opposite inputs. For keyboard input only.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Actor
member.summary: Base class for all actor objects on the scene.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Actor.EulerAngles
member.summary: The rotation as Euler angles in degrees.
member.remarks: The x, y, and z angles represent a rotation z degrees around the z axis, x degrees around the x axis, and y degrees around the y axis (in that order). Angles order (xyz): pitch, yaw and roll.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Actor.LocalEulerAngles
member.summary: The local rotation as Euler angles in degrees.
member.remarks: The x, y, and z angles represent a rotation z degrees around the z axis, x degrees around the x axis, and y degrees around the y axis (in that order). Angles order (xyz): pitch, yaw and roll.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.PerBoneMotionBlur
member.summary: If true, use per-bone motion blur on this skeletal model. It requires additional rendering, can be disabled to save performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UseTimeScale
member.summary: If true, animation speed will be affected by the global time scale parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the animation will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the animations themselves will also stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateMode
member.summary: The animation update mode. Can be used to optimize the performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.BoundsScale
member.summary: The master scale parameter for the actor bounding box. Helps reducing mesh flickering effect on screen edges.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.CustomBounds
member.summary: The custom bounds(in actor local space). If set to empty bounds then source skinned model bind pose bounds will be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.LODBias
member.summary: The model Level Of Detail bias value. Allows to increase or decrease rendered model quality.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ForcedLOD

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog
member.summary: Used to create fogging effects such as clouds but with a density that is related to the height of the fog.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogDensity
member.summary: The fog density factor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogHeightFalloff
member.summary: The fog height density factor that controls how the density increases as height decreases. The smaller values produce more visible transition larger.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogInscatteringColor
member.summary: Color of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogMaxOpacity
member.summary: Maximum opacity of the fog. A value of 1 means the fog can become fully opaque at a distance and replace scene color completely. A value of 0 means the fog color will not be factored in at all.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.StartDistance
member.summary: Distance from the camera that the fog will start, in world units.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogCutoffDistance
member.summary: Scene elements past this distance will not have fog applied. This is useful for excluding skyboxes which already have fog baked in.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringLight
member.summary: Directional light used for Directional Inscattering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringExponent
member.summary: Controls the size of the directional inscattering cone, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used. Range: 2-64.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance
member.summary: Controls the start distance from the viewer of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEnable
member.summary: Whether to enable Volumetric fog. Graphics quality settings control the resolution of the fog simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogScatteringDistribution
member.summary: Controls the scattering phase function - how much incoming light scatters in various directions. A distribution value of 0 scatters equally in all directions, while 0.9 scatters predominantly in the light direction. In order to have visible volumetric fog light shafts from the side, the distribution will need to be closer to 0. Range: -0.9-0.9.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogAlbedo
member.summary: The height fog particle reflectiveness used by volumetric fog. Water particles in air have an albedo near white, while dust has slightly darker value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEmissive
member.summary: Light emitted by height fog. This is a density so more light is emitted the further you are looking through the fog. In most cases using a Skylight is a better choice, however, it may be useful in certain scenarios.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogExtinctionScale
member.summary: Scales the height fog particle extinction amount used by volumetric fog. Values larger than 1 cause fog particles everywhere absorb more light. Range: 0.1-10.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogDistance
member.summary: Distance over which volumetric fog should be computed. Larger values extend the effect into the distance but expose under-sampling artifacts in details.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.VolumetricScatteringIntensity
member.summary: Controls how much this light will contribute to the Volumetric Fog. When set to 0, there is no contribution.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.CastVolumetricShadow
member.summary: Toggles whether or not to cast a volumetric shadow for lights contributing to Volumetric Fog. Also shadows casting by this light should be enabled in order to make it cast volumetric fog shadow.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Prefab
member.summary: Json asset that stores the collection of scene objects including actors and scripts. In general it can serve as any grouping of scene objects (for example a level) or be used as a form of a template instantiated and reused throughout the scene.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Prefab.GetDefaultInstance
member.summary: Requests the default prefab object instance. Deserializes the prefab objects from the asset. Skips if already done.
member.returns: The root of the prefab object loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Prefab.GetDefaultInstance(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Requests the default prefab object instance. Deserializes the prefab objects from the asset. Skips if already done.
member.param: The ID of the object to get from prefab default object. It can be one of the child-actors or any script that exists in the prefab. Methods returns root if id is empty.
member.returns: The object of the prefab loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.summary: Creates the prefab asset from the given root actor. Saves it to the output file path.

True if auto-connect the target actor and related objects to the created prefab.

member.summary: Applies the difference from the prefab object instance, saves the changes and synchronizes them with the active instances of the prefab asset.
member.remarks: Applies all the changes from not only the given actor instance but all actors created within that prefab instance.
member.returns: True if data is failed to apply the changes, otherwise false.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Scene.AssetTypename
member.summary: The scene asset typename. Type of the serialized scene asset data. Hidden class for the scene assets. Actors deserialization rules are strictly controlled under the hood by the C++ core parts. Mostly because scene asset has the same ID as scene root actor so loading both managed objects for scene asset and scene will crash (due to object ids conflict).

member.param: The bounds in world-space to build overlapping tiles.
The timeout to wait before building Nav Mesh (in milliseconds).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavLink
member.summary: The off-mesh link objects used to define a custom point-to-point edge within the navigation graph. An off-mesh connection is a user defined traversable connection made up to two vertices, at least one of which resides within a navigation mesh polygon allowing movement outside the navigation mesh.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsKinematic
member.summary: Enables kinematic mode for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
Kinematic rigidbodies are special dynamic actors that are not influenced by forces(such as gravity), and have no momentum. They are considered to have infinite mass and can push regular dynamic actors out of the way. Kinematics will not collide with static or other kinematic objects.
Kinematic rigidbodies are great for moving platforms or characters, where direct motion control is desired.
Kinematic rigidbodies are incompatible with CCD.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce linear movement.
member.remarks: Linear damping can be used to slow down an object. The higher the drag the more the object slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce angular movement.
member.remarks: Angular damping can be used to slow down the rotation of an object. The higher the drag the more the rotation slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableSimulation
member.summary: If true simulation and collisions detection will be enabled for the rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UseCCD
member.summary: If true Continuous Collision Detection (CCD) will be used for this component.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableGravity
member.summary: If object should have the force of gravity applied.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.StartAwake
member.summary: If object should start awake, or if it should initially be sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMassWhenScaleChanges
member.summary: If true, it will update mass when actor scale changes.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular velocity that a simulated object can achieve.
member.remarks: The angular velocity of rigidbodies is clamped to MaxAngularVelocity to avoid numerical instability with fast rotating bodies. Because this may prevent intentional fast rotations on objects such as wheels, you can override this value per rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.OverrideMass
member.summary: Override the auto computed mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass value measured in kilograms (use override value only if EnableOverrideMass is enabled).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MassScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the per-instance scaling of the mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMassOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the user specified offset for the center of mass of this object, from the calculated location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the object movement constraint flags that define degrees of freedom are allowed for the simulation of object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear velocity of the rigidbody.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular velocity of the rigidbody measured in radians per second.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current angular velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depenetration velocity when rigidbody moving out of penetrating state.
member.remarks: This value controls how much velocity the solver can introduce to correct for penetrations in contacts. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SleepThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass-normalized kinetic energy threshold below which an actor may go to sleep.
member.remarks: Actors whose kinetic energy divided by their mass is below this threshold will be candidates for sleeping.

member.summary: Gets the center of the mass in the local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsSleeping
member.summary: Determines whether this rigidbody is sleeping.

member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to sleep (for at least one frame).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.WakeUp
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to wake up.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMass
member.summary: Updates the actor's mass (auto calculated mass from density and inertia tensor or overriden value).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce a torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system) at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce a torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the world space to the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system).
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SetSolverIterationCounts(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the solver iteration counts for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
The solver iteration count determines how accurately joints and contacts are resolved. If you are having trouble with jointed bodies oscillating and behaving erratically, then setting a higher position iteration count may improve their stability.
If intersecting bodies are being depenetrated too violently, increase the number of velocity iterations. More velocity iterations will drive the relative exit velocity of the intersecting objects closer to the correct value given the restitution.
Default: 4 position iterations, 1 velocity iteration.
member.param: The minimum number of position iterations the solver should perform for this body.
The minimum number of velocity iterations the solver should perform for this body.

member.summary: Gets a point on one of the colliders attached to the attached that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
The result point on the rigidbody shape that is closest to the specified location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.IsTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'IsTrigger' flag.
member.remarks: A trigger doesn't register a collision with an incoming Rigidbody. Instead, it sends OnTriggerEnter, OnTriggerExit and OnTriggerStay message when a rigidbody enters or exits the trigger volume.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the collider, measured in the object's local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.ContactOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact offset.
member.remarks: Colliders whose distance is less than the sum of their ContactOffset values will generate contacts. The contact offset must be positive. Contact offset allows the collision detection system to predictively enforce the contact constraint even when the objects are slightly separated.

member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Gets a point on the collider that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ComputePenetration(FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Computes minimum translational distance between two geometry objects. Translating the first collider by direction * distance will separate the colliders apart if the function returned true. Otherwise, direction and distance are not defined. The one of the colliders has to be BoxCollider, SphereCollider CapsuleCollider or a convex MeshCollider. The other one can be any type. If objects do not overlap, the function can not compute the distance and returns false.
member.param: The computed direction along which the translation required to separate the colliders apart is minimal. Valid only if function returns true.
The penetration distance along direction that is required to separate the colliders apart. Valid only if function returns true.
member.returns: True if the distance has successfully been computed, i.e. if objects do overlap, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the step height. The character will step up a stair only if it is closer to the ground than the indicated value. This should not be greater than the Character Controllers height or it will generate an error.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.MinMoveDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum move distance of the character controller. The minimum travelled distance to consider. If travelled distance is smaller, the character doesn't move. This is used to stop the recursive motion algorithm when remaining distance to travel is small.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Velocity
member.summary: Gets the linear velocity of the Character Controller. This allows tracking how fast the character is actually moving, for instance when it is stuck at a wall this value will be the near zero vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.IsGrounded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this character was grounded during last move call grounded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Flags
member.summary: Gets the current collision flags. Tells which parts of the character capsule collided with the environment during the last move call. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.SimpleMove(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character with the given speed. Gravity is automatically applied. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Move(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character using a 'collide-and-slide' algorithm. Attempts to move the controller by the given displacement vector, the motion will only be constrained by collisions. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move. This function does not apply any gravity.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.summary: A collision triangle mesh consists of a collection of vertices and the triangle indices.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags
member.summary: Set of flags used to generate model convex mesh. Allows to customize process.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Disables the convex mesh validation to speed-up hull creation. Creating a convex mesh with invalid input data without prior validation may result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UsePlaneShifting
member.summary:
Enables plane shifting vertex limit algorithm.
Plane shifting is an alternative algorithm for the case when the computed hull has more vertices than the specified vertex limit.
The default algorithm computes the full hull, and an OBB around the input vertices. This OBB is then sliced with the hull planes until the vertex limit is reached. The default algorithm requires the vertex limit to be set to at least 8, and typically produces results that are much better quality than are produced by plane shifting.
When plane shifting is enabled, the hull computation stops when vertex limit is reached.The hull planes are then shifted to contain all input vertices, and the new plane intersection points are then used to generate the final hull with the given vertex limit.Plane shifting may produce sharp edges to vertices very far away from the input cloud, and does not guarantee that all input vertices are inside the resulting hull. However, it can be used with a vertex limit as low as 4.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UseFastInteriaComputation
member.summary: Inertia tensor computation is faster using SIMD code, but the precision is lower, which may result in incorrect inertia for very thin hulls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.ShiftVertices
member.summary: Convex hull input vertices are shifted to be around origin to provide better computation stability. It is recommended to provide input vertices around the origin, otherwise use this flag to improve numerical stability.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType
member.summary: Type of drives that can be used for moving or rotating bodies attached to the joint.
member.remarks:
Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity)
Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force.
A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set.There are two possible models for angular drive : swing / twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.X
member.summary: Linear movement on the X axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Y
member.summary: Linear movement on the Y axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Z
member.summary: Linear movement on the Z axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Swing
member.summary: Rotation around the Y axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Twist
member.summary: Rotation around the Z axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Slerp
member.summary: Rotation using spherical linear interpolation. Uses the SLERP angular drive mode which performs rotation by interpolating the quaternion values directly over the shortest path (applies to all three axes, which they all must be unlocked).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.MAX
member.summary: The count of items in the D6JointDriveType enum.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6Joint
member.summary: Physics joint that is the most customizable type of joint. This joint type can be used to create all other built-in joint types, and to design your own custom ones, but is less intuitive to use.Allows a specification of a linear constraint (for example for a slider), twist constraint (rotating around X) and swing constraint (rotating around Y and Z). It also allows you to constrain limits to only specific axes or completely lock specific axes.

Distance from the limit at which it becomes active. Allows the solver to activate earlier than the limit is reached to avoid breaking the limit. Specify -1 for the default.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,FlaxEngine.SpringParameters,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a soft limit. Once the limit is reached the bodies will bounce back according to the restitution parameter and will be pulled back towards the limit by the provided spring.
member.param: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.
The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.
The spring that controls how are the bodies pulled back towards the limit when they breach it.

Controls how do objects react when the limit is reached, values closer to zero specify non-elastic collision, while those closer to one specify more elastic (i.e bouncy) collision. Must be in [0, 1] range.

member.summary: Physics joint that removes all but a single translational degree of freedom. Bodies are allowed to move along a single axis.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SliderJoint.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets the joint mode flags. Controls joint behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SliderJoint.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the joint limit properties.
member.remarks: Determines the limit of the joint. Limit constrains the motion to the specified angle range. You must enable the limit flag on the joint in order for this to be recognized.

member.summary: The none.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.SphericalJointFlag.Limit
member.summary: The joint cone range limit is enabled.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint
member.summary: Physics joint that removes all translational degrees of freedom but allows all rotational degrees of freedom. Essentially this ensures that the anchor points of the two bodies are always coincident. Bodies are allowed to rotate around the anchor points, and their rotation can be limited by an elliptical cone.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets the joint mode flags. Controls joint behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the joint limit properties.
member.remarks: Determines the limit of the joint. Limit constrains the motion to the specified angle range. You must enable the limit flag on the joint in order for this to be recognized.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.Simulate(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during main engine loop to start physic simulation. Use CollectResults after.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.CollectResults
member.summary: Called during main engine loop to collect physic simulation results and apply them as well as fire collision events.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode
member.summary: Enumeration that determines the way in which two material properties will be combined to yield a friction or restitution coefficient for a collision.
member.remarks: Physics doesn't have any inherent combinations because the coefficients are determined empirically on a case by case basis. However, simulating this with a pairwise lookup table is often impractical. The effective combine mode for the pair is maximum(material0.combineMode, material1.combineMode).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Average
member.summary: Uses the average value of the touching materials: (a+b)/2.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Minimum
member.summary: Uses the smaller value of the touching materials: min(a,b)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the values of the touching materials: a*b

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Maximum
member.summary: Uses the larger value of the touching materials: max(a, b)

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ForceMode
member.summary: Force mode type determines the exact operation that is carried out when applying the force on a rigidbody.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Force
member.summary: Add a continuous force to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time^2, i.e. a force.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Impulse
member.summary: Add an instant force impulse to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.VelocityChange
member.summary: Add an instant velocity change to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time, i.e. the effect is mass independent: a velocity change.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Acceleration
member.summary: Add a continuous acceleration to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time^2, i.e. an acceleration. It gets treated just like a force except the mass is not divided out before integration.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.None
member.summary: No constraints.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionX
member.summary: Freeze motion along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionY
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionZ
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationX
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationY
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationZ
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPosition
member.summary: Freeze motion along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotation
member.summary: Freeze rotation along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockAll
member.summary: Freeze rotation and motion along all axes.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Object.Destroy(FlaxEngine.Object,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the specified object and clears the reference variable. The object obj will be destroyed now or after the time specified in seconds from now. If obj is a Script it will be removed from the Actor and deleted. If obj is an Actor it will be removed from the Scene and deleted as well as all its Scripts and all children of the Actor. Actual object destruction is always delayed until after the current Update loop, but will always be done before rendering.
member.param: The time left to destroy object (in seconds).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Object.Destroy``1(``0@,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the specified object and clears the reference variable. The object obj will be destroyed now or after the time specified in seconds from now. If obj is a Script it will be removed from the Actor and deleted. If obj is an Actor it will be removed from the Scene and deleted as well as all its Scripts and all children of the Actor. Actual object destruction is always delayed until after the current Update loop, but will always be done before rendering.
member.param: The time left to destroy object (in seconds).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Terrain
member.summary: Represents a single terrain object.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.UnitsPerVertex
member.summary: The constant amount of units per terrain geometry vertex (can be adjusted per terrain instance using non-uniform scale factor).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.MaxLODs
member.summary: The maximum amount of levels of detail for the terrain chunks.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.PatchChunksCount
member.summary: The constant amount of terrain chunks per terrain patch object.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.PatchEdgeChunksCount
member.summary: The constant amount of terrain chunks on terrain patch object edge.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.MaxSplatmapsCount
member.summary: The terrain splatmaps amount limit. Each splatmap can hold up to 4 layer weights.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The height map. Each array item contains a height value (2D inlined array). It should has size equal (chunkSize*4+1)^2.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.

The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: The default material used for terrain rendering (chunks can override this).

member.summary: The physical material used to define the terrain collider physical properties.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.DrawModes
member.summary: The draw passes to use for rendering this object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.LODBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain Level Of Detail bias value. Allows to increase or decrease rendered terrain quality.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.ForcedLOD
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain forced Level Of Detail index. Allows to bind the given chunks LOD to show. Value -1 disables this feature.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.LODDistribution
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain LODs distribution parameter. Adjusts terrain chunks transitions distances. Use lower value to increase terrain quality or higher value to increase performance. Default value is 0.75.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.ScaleInLightmap
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain scale in lightmap (applied to all the chunks). Use value higher than 1 to increase baked lighting resolution.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.BoundsExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain chunks bounds extent. Values used to expand terrain chunks bounding boxes. Use it when your terrain material is performing vertex offset operations on a GPU.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.CollisionLOD
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain geometry LOD index used for collision.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.LODCount
member.summary: Gets the terrain Level Of Detail count.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.ChunkSize
member.summary: Gets the terrain chunk vertices amount per edge (square).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.PatchesCount
member.summary: Gets the terrain patches count. Each patch contains 16 chunks arranged into a 4x4 square.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.HasPatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Checks if terrain has the patch at the given coordinates.
member.returns: True if has patch added, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the terrain patch in the terrain patches collection.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the terrain patch in the terrain patches collection. Returns -1 if patch coordinates are invalid.

member.summary: Gets the terrain patch coordinates (x and z) at the given index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the terrain patch in the terrain patches collection.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.GetPatchBounds(System.Int32,FlaxEngine.BoundingBox@)
member.summary: Gets the terrain patch world bounds at the given index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the terrain patch in the terrain patches collection.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.GetChunkBounds(System.Int32,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.BoundingBox@)
member.summary: Gets the terrain chunk world bounds at the given index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the terrain patch in the terrain patches collection.
The zero-based index of the terrain chunk in the terrain patch chunks collection (in range 0-15).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.GetChunkOverrideMaterial(FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Gets the chunk material that overrides the terrain default one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetChunkOverrideMaterial(FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.MaterialBase)
member.summary: Sets the chunk material to override the terrain default one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Single*,System.Byte*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The height map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The height map. Each array item contains a height value.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch layer weights using the specified splatmaps data.
member.param: The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.
The splatmap map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.Setup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Setups the terrain. Clears the existing data.
member.param: The LODs count. The actual amount of LODs may be lower due to provided chunk size (each LOD has 4 times less quads).
The size of the chunk (amount of quads per edge for the highest LOD). Must be power of two minus one (eg. 63 or 127).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatches(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patches to the terrain (clears existing ones).
member.param: The number of patches (x and z axis).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patch.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RemovePatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Removes the patch.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Ray,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape. Returns the hit chunk.
member.param: The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain patch coordinates (x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain chunk coordinates (relative to the patch, x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.RayCastHit@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against terrain collision, returns results in a RayCastHit structure.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The result hit information. Valid only when method returns true.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Gets a point on the terrain collider that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
The result point on the collider that is closest to the specified location.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode
member.summary: The canvas rendering modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.ScreenSpace
member.summary: The screen space rendering mode that places UI elements on the screen rendered on top of the scene. If the screen is resized or changes resolution, the Canvas will automatically change size to match this.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.CameraSpace
member.summary: The camera space rendering mode that places Canvas in a given distance in front of a specified Camera. The UI elements are rendered by this camera, which means that the Camera settings affect the appearance of the UI. If the Camera is set to Perspective, the UI elements will be rendered with perspective, and the amount of perspective distortion can be controlled by the Camera Field of View. If the screen is resized, changes resolution, or the camera frustum changes, the Canvas will automatically change size to match as well.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.WorldSpace
member.summary: The world space rendering mode that places Canvas as any other object in the scene. The size of the Canvas can be set manually using its Transform, and UI elements will render in front of or behind other objects in the scene based on 3D placement. This is useful for UIs that are meant to be a part of the world. This is also known as a 'diegetic interface'.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderer
member.summary: PostFx used to render the . Used when render mode is or .

member.summary: The canvas to render.
